content.text:
# Bhuvaneswari (actress)

Bhuvaneswari (born Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh) is an Indian model, film and television actress, known for her contributions to South Indian cinema and television. She has received critical acclaim for her antagonist roles in several soap operas. She rose to stardom with the 2003 Tamil film, Boys in which she played Rani as a cameo appearance. Kurkure is her first film in a lead role. In 1999, she is well known for her debut antagonist revenge role in Gokulam Veedu television serial as younger daughter  which got more attention and trigger among audiences and hence received more antagonist roles in several soap operas.
